title: Vector Representation
text: A vector is represented by each of its components, which are denoted by the $$x_1$$, $$x_2$$, and $$x_3$$.

title: Standard Basis Vectors
text: Since the input is in $$R^3$$, the standard basis vectors for $$\pm e_1$$ and $$\pm e_2$$ have three components. The component that corresponds to the number of the basis vector is $$1$$ while all other components are $$0$$.

title: First Standard Basis Vector
text: What is the first standard basis vector in R3 with $$3$$ components?

title: Evaluating the Function
text: To evaluate the function, plug in the components of the standard basis vectors that correspond to $$x_1$$, $$x_2$$, and $$x_3$$.

title: Plugging in Components
text: What is the output for the first standard basis vector when $$1$$ is plugged in as $$x_1$$ and $$0$$ as both $$x_2$$ and $$x_3$$?

title: Negation of basis vectors
text: To find the negative of the vector, multiply each of its components by $$-1$$ and change the sign.

title: Trigonometry
text: The sine and cosine values for positive and negative pi are either $$0$$ or $$1$$.
